website_summaries.verdict: WordPress for Android is a must-install smartphone and tablet app for those who frequently use the WordPress blogging platform, but a few missteps keep the app from greatness.
pros: Lets you upload photos and video directly from a mobile device
cons: Lacks a dedicated search function for posts and pages

customer_reviews.title: Needs updates!
customer_reviews.text: The app works OK. However updates! Like many of the non Amazon apps on here, the developer never thinks to extend updates to the Fire apps. I also have this on my phone via Android. There are regular updates but you never update the Fire app. The only app updates I ever regularly receive on my Fire tablet are from Twitter. As far as I know this is down to individual developers and not Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: A Book n Brew

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I can't always access the notifications under the bell or leave a comment on my Kindle/Silk browser, so I got the WordPress app - which has brought about its own problems: Can't follow or unfollow other bloggers or comment at times. Flaky. Get it sorted WordPress.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for beginners
customer_reviews.text: There’s a few things I’m still trying to get my head around but it’s getting easier. Setting your site up can be quite confusing but once you figure it out you have the option to amend it as much as you like. Publishing your posts is very easy. All in all it’s great. Can’t complain about anything really.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I've just found about 200 pending comments going back over a year !! And why does it keep saying I have drafts I havent published when I have published them ! Why are comments different to notifications ? And how do you block someone ?
customer_reviews.author: eevee

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: I love WordPress and there is nothing I would change about it. Of course I haven't seen the whole app yet, but if all of it is as good as the bits I've seen this app is flawless. The app was so useful when I was setting up my blog and is still so helpful 1 month on from then!
customer_reviews.author: nat

customer_reviews.title: A good app gone bad
customer_reviews.text: This app did work well but now it refuses to let me login at all despite resetting my password on my PC
customer_reviews.author: xmetman

customer_reviews.title: Worst WordPress app
customer_reviews.text: Would not work so tried reinstalling and now no longer have the option to install, let alone use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've just decided to create my own blog around health, fitness and tech and this is the easiest and fastest way to get set up by far!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Works OK, with a few weird quirks!
customer_reviews.text: Instead of my stats, it seems to load the WP stats, which is very odd, and I have to navigate through a few screens to get to my posts and pages. But it's handy when I'm out. However, have not tried posting from mobile yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I blog using a PC, the mobile version seems just as goid
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Disapointed how long the order took to arrive compared to others and it arrived the day after it promised
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Spandangler

customer_reviews.title: Does a job
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to use as a web browser but useful none-the-less.
customer_reviews.author: Phat Planet

customer_reviews.title: Good for use in conjunction with web
customer_reviews.text: Missing quite a few features of the web based version - including the ability to copy a hyperlink of an existing post. VEry easy to use in conjunction with the web based site (I use it for updating posts that I have started on the web).
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: This app kept crashing.
customer_reviews.text: I lost a blog draft while trying to upload an image.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Almost useless
customer_reviews.text: I managed to create an account on the app, but it won't let me log in on it, so I had to install it on my phone, wasting more memory. A bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Evamore

customer_reviews.title: Works great- lovely interface. However, I have given ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great- lovely interface. However, I have given it 4 stars as there seems to be a problem when it comes to setting a feature image for a post. When previewing my blog online, I discovered that the feature image simply displayed as a grey icon.
customer_reviews.author: zeinab mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Five star is expensive
customer_reviews.text: Every moment on wordpress is utterly delightful I want a free wordpress badge.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: This was the first blog app I have ever used, so I don't know about any other blog apps. But Wordpress is just incredible. Can't think of any negatives of the top of my head. Would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Helps with My Off Line creation of sites for resale.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Cann

customer_reviews.title: Great for working on your website or blog.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well, easy and simply.You can find more detailed reviews on my website www.samreviews.co.uk
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great app that takes you straight to the wordpress site
customer_reviews.author: Malcf8

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Always loads fast and is great to keep eye on my blog
customer_reviews.author: CLAIRE DAVEY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love wordpress, very customiseable and the best blog site i know
customer_reviews.author: Crmer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Wordpress Users
customer_reviews.text: As a wordpress blogger this app is a welcome edition to the Kindle Fire collection. It allows me to connect to my blog, manage posts and notifications quickly as well as add additonal posts on the go. I can also access posts from the Wordpress blogs I follow quickly and simply. If you use Wordpress, this is a very useful app which will aid the blogging process
customer_reviews.author: Wobette

customer_reviews.title: Lags and is slow.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to download this app as I am an avid blogger and it's not easy to do on ones phone so I thought this would be great when I can't be bothered to get the laptop out. However, I find it's very slow, lags a lot and crashes very often, it lacks a lot of the features that the website has and just generally needs a bit of work doing to it! It is easy to read other blogs you follow though, so if that is more what you are looking for then this would be fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: katevondarcy

customer_reviews.title: Does the basics
customer_reviews.text: I use this app regularly to keep tabs on my blog. From the app I can look at my posts, stats and any receive and reply to any comments made on it. Very convenient to use, I don't know how I lived without it.
customer_reviews.author: Cleopatra

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Nothing could make blog posting easier. WordPress sites look the best and this is the way to maintain them. Great product and very easy to master.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Blogging.
customer_reviews.text: If you want too start a blog, WordPress is the best out there, it has lots of tools and plenty of help to get your blog up and running
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: WordPress
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a kindle fire hdx and needed to d/l wordpress again as I use it on other devices & PCs.
customer_reviews.author: karmashadow©

customer_reviews.title: Look to other apps
customer_reviews.text: Whilst I am under no impression this would work fine on a laptop, the app has caused me so much frustration having twice deleted entire posts, not into the trash folder but into thin air as drafts. I am stuck with the company having started a blog on it but if you are new and will be using a phone or tablet, try a different one. Real shame such a large company has these issues as when they do post the blogs are aesthetically great
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ward

customer_reviews.title: latest upgrade has bugs
customer_reviews.text: Yeah the app isn't as good as using the website but it's handy when you're on the go without access to a computer. Have been using it on a 6 month trip without issues until the latest upgrade which is causing it to crash constantly. This happens when writing in bold. You can write one word in bold and as soon as you click the spacebar it crashes! Please sort this major bug wordpress. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jibba

customer_reviews.title: Come to bed with me
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid wordpress user anyway so this app is great for working through the reader without having to lug the laptop into bed for some late-night reading. Not a fan of typing on it - but I think that's more the kindle in general.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Good App
customer_reviews.text: I am fairly new to Wordpress and still coming to grips with the main package but this android app is easy to install and linked quickly to my main wordpress address giving me another way to view my blog.
customer_reviews.author: GerryO

customer_reviews.title: Great App
customer_reviews.text: I found this app to be completely helpful. I could view my reader, write a post schedule a post. All the things I needed. There wasn't as much options as on the computer but I could do everything I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Abbajail

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Even better app than the native desktop one - it's simple, elegant and very user friendly. Addictive - makes blogging (and blog monitoring) a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Aucock

customer_reviews.title: umm
customer_reviews.text: Still getting my head round using this on my kindle. Struggling to manage my blog from laptop hoping this will help.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-ann Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: Somehow, using Wordpress on the computer really shows that this app is a little 'rough and clumsy'. Things just seem to take an age and many aspects of the 'real' thing are lacking.
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: So slow and major issue is it won't let me insert pictures into my text. Have wasted hours on it.not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: while I hate it, when click word press nothing coming up
customer_reviews.text: while I hate it, when click word press nothing coming up, as I thought I could write letters to my family with WordPress on my Kindly Fire, Help./...Johann Adolf Klement
customer_reviews.author: Johann Adolf Klement

customer_reviews.title: STUPID
customer_reviews.text: I WROTE 3,000 WORDS IN 3HOURS AND I FINALLY PUBLISHED THE STORY, I WA STARTING TO THINK THAT THIS APP WAS GOOD AND USEFUL BUT IT ERASED THE WHOLE STORY AND ASKED ME TO WRITE AGAIN, I'VE BEEN A CELEB BEFORE
customer_reviews.author: Natalie
